alert.note: Alert for Garza (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 01 at 8:07PM CDT until June 02 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Lubbock has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Texas... Double Mountain Fork Brazos at Justiceburg affecting Garza County. For the Double Mountain Fork Brazos...including Justiceburg, Aspermont 10S, Lubbock 4ESE...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Double Mountain Fork Brazos at Justiceburg. * WHEN...From this evening to late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, The pool elevation of Lake Alan Henry will increase significantly. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 13.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 7.1 feet by Friday night. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. This product will be updated late tonight at 200 AM CDT.
